label: Assesment Type
name: assesment_type
errormsg: Please select one of the following assesesment type

name: aide_education_completed
errormsg: Please make sure to check this
label: Aide Covide Screening Education Complete

options.title: Aide was instructed to conduct a daily symptom check before going to work. In case of any symptoms below, instructed not to report to and notify agency immediately: Temperature of 100.0 F (37.8 C) or higher, cough, shortness of breath and/or sore throat. Recheck of symptoms must occur every 8 hours while at work or between shifts if working for multiple patients. If any symptoms develop while at work, must isolate in the patient's home and notify agency immediately.

label: Can patient be left alone ? ( Note , TBI, Split Shift, and NHTD cases must never be left alone)
name: can_patient_be_alone

options.title: Change in SOB in last 6 months

label: Nutritional Risk/Assessment
name: nutritional_risks

options.title: Is elderly, lives alone and dependent for shopping, meal prep and/or feeding
Is on a fluid restricted diet
Has Oral/dental problems that makes eating difficult
Eats fewer than 2 meals per day
is on more than 3 RX or over the counter medications
Takes more than 2 drinks (beer,alcohol, wine) a day

details:
Legend for Nutritional/Risk Assessment


0-2: No Risk, 3-5: Moderate Risk, 6 or more: High Risk

Follow up if High Risk

label: Does PCG or Aide note pain ?
name: noted_pain

label: Pain Scale
name: pain_scale
errormsg: Please select one of the following assesesment type

label: Fall Risk Assessment
name: fall_risk_assessment

options.title: Diagnosis - 3 or more coexisting diagnosed conditions
Prior History of Falls within 3 months
Environmental hazards including inappropriate footwear, ptes, hard to reach items, rugs, uneven floor surfaces
Polypharmacy - 4 or more medications/postural hypotension with dizziness

details: Scores more than 4 are at high risk

label: If Total score exceeds 4 educate and ask patient if they would be interested in physical therapy services
name: therapty_service

label: Has the patient had a recent fall ?
name: recent_fall

label: Is client able to administrate own medications
name: client_can_administrate_medicine

label: Does client require medication box setup/pre-pour?
name: client_needs_medications

label: Is client compliant with medication regimen?
name: client_compliant_with_regimen

label: Aide educated to remind patient to take medications
name: educated_to_remind_patient

label: Mammogram Or Breast Exam - within 2 years for women of 50+ or HX
name: breast_exam

label: Educated Paint/PCG on benefits of utilizing urgent care rather than ER for minor issues
name: education_on_benefits

options.title: Local utility companies notified of life support equipment
Sanitary and safe for provision of care
Medicine clearly labeled within reach of client and secured from children
RN provided education regarding safety concerns
Plan of care Reviewed/Revised With Patient PCG Involvement
